narrative.title: Ii Corps - 1943Q1

situation.operational_situation: Initial setbacks followed by reorganization and improved performance
key_events: Kasserine Pass defeat (Feb 19-25) - first major US ground combat defeat WWII
Patton assumes command (March 6) - transformation of corps effectiveness
Battle of El Guettar (late March) - first significant US victory against German armor
Integration into 18th Army Group under General Alexander

replacements_by_end_q1.vehicles: Full replacement of lost trucks from North African supply chain
replacements_by_end_q1.note: Not all losses fully replaced by end of Q1

combat_effectiveness.early_q1: Poor - inexperienced troops, dispersed positions, inadequate coordination
combat_effectiveness.post_kasserine: Improving - lessons learned, consolidation of positions
combat_effectiveness.post_patton: Good - improved leadership, better tactics, higher morale
combat_effectiveness.end_q1: Effective - ready for final Tunisia offensive in Q2

narrative.axis_objective: Maintain defensive positions and inflict maximum casualties on Allied forces.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and secure strategic objectives while minimizing casualties.
